**Trieve: Simplifying AI-Powered Search**

Founded in 2023 and currently part of Y Combinator’s Batch W24, Trieve is a San Francisco-based startup on a mission to revolutionize the way search and recommendations are done. With a relatively small team of just 7 employees, Trieve is tackling one of the most complex problems in tech: building an effective search infrastructure.

At its core, Trieve serves as an all-in-one API designed for search, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and recommendations. Think of it as the ultimate toolkit for developers who want to integrate sophisticated search capabilities into their applications without the usual hassle. Historically, creating a robust search function could take months, but Trieve promises a production-ready solution that works right out of the box.

### What Sets Trieve Apart?

Trieve combines cutting-edge search language models with advanced tools that allow teams to fine-tune their search results. The features include:
- **Semantic Vector and Hybrid Search**: Out-of-the-box support for both semantic and full-text search.
- **Custom Models and Embedding Options**: A flexible infrastructure that allows for stock or custom embedding models.
- **Relevancy Tuning**: Fine-tune search results and boost performance via an API or a no-code dashboard.
- **Comprehensive Coverage**: From chunking data to providing analytics, Trieve covers all bases with its API.

This comprehensive approach lets teams manage everything from ingestion to analytics with ease. For those with stringent data requirements, Trieve even offers self-hosting capabilities.

### Use Cases and Applications

Today, Trieve is already powering over 30,000 discovery experiences across various sectors, including e-commerce and analytics. Companies leveraging Trieve can build a competitive edge by enhancing their search functionality and overall user experience.

### Why Choose Trieve?

If you want to set up industry-leading search capabilities in under 30 minutes, Trieve is your go-to solution. By simply uploading data, integrating the API, and tweaking search parameters, businesses can have a sophisticated search engine up and running without extensive downtime or ongoing maintenance burdens. 

In short, if search is a crucial component of your product, or if you’re committed to building an exceptional discovery experience, Trieve positions itself as a powerful partner. For a closer look at what Trieve can do, visit their website at [trieve.ai](https://trieve.ai) or request a demo to see the magic in action.

Shaped provides tools that allow businesses to seamlessly integrate sophisticated search and recommendation functionalities into their existing workflow. Their system adapts in real-time, meaning that as user behavior changes, so too do the recommendations and search results. This adaptability translates into higher engagement and better user experiences across platforms, whether it’s a marketplace, e-commerce site, or media platform.

Their product offerings include:
- **Semantic Search**: Making search results more relevant by understanding user intent better.
- **Recommendations**: Tailoring suggestions based on user behavior and preferences.
- **Analytics**: Providing insights into user interactions and system performance.

**Why Choose Shaped?**

1. **Easy Integration**: Businesses can connect to Shaped rapidly without extensive overhauls of their existing data systems.
2. **Real-Time Adaptability**: The platform utilizes behavioral signals to adjust recommendations dynamically.
3. **Advanced Technology**: Shaped makes use of Large Language Models (LLMs) for nuanced understanding of unstructured data.
4. **Customization**: Users can create and test various ranking models tailored to their specific needs.
5. **Security**: With enterprise-grade security measures, including GDPR and SOC2 compliance, Shaped is designed with data privacy in mind.

Shaped has built a platform that caters not just to developers but also to data scientists and data engineers, ensuring that everyone can benefit from its capabilities.

**Proven Impact**

Shaped boasts impressive metrics:
- Over 100 million users and items processed.
- Capable of handling over 1,000 queries per second.
- In some implementations, clients have seen up to a 4x increase in redemption rates and a 16% lift in average order value.

So if you’re looking to fundamentally change how your users interact with your digital spaces, consider Shaped. With their innovative approach to AI-driven recommendations and a proven track record of success, they may just be the partner you need to elevate your platform’s performance.

You can learn more or request a demo through their [website](https://shaped.ai).

- **Rebalance**: Automated suggestions to allocate inventory effectively.
- **Reorder**: Predicting top-performing products to prevent stock outages.
- **Buy**: Facilitating purchasing decisions based on data-driven insights.
- **Analyze**: Tracking product performance across various sales channels.

**Why It Matters:**
With the retail landscape becoming increasingly competitive, Metreecs champions the idea that intelligent inventory decisions can differentiate successful retailers from those struggling to keep up. metadata.description:
Promi is an AI-powered price and discount optimization platform. We help eCommerce merchants personalize their sales to generate additional revenue and profit.

Ecommerce merchants and marketers typically use discounts to drive customer acquisition, boost sales during holidays, or liquidate inventory. But deciding on a discount to offer is typically guesswork. Who to send the discount to, how much to offer, and which products it applies to are, in the most advanced cases, determined manually by looking at past sales and seeing what worked well. In the majority of cases, it's what feels and sounds good.

Promi leverages store data to optimize discounts at a more granular level than possible manually. We dynamically determine the best value across each product, for different users, at different times in order to maximize sales and profit.
metadata.founder_1_description: Co-founder @ Promi, a pricing and discount optimization platform. Prior to Promi I led product for discounts at Uber. I have a degree in economics and computer science from Harvard.
metadata.founder_2_description:
Co-founder of Promi. Most of my career has been working on recommendation / personalization systems in the e-commerce space.

Avid coder and lifelong learner.
metadata.generated_description:
### Promi: Smart Pricing for eCommerce

**Overview**

Founded in 2024 and part of Y Combinator’s Batch S24, Promi is a budding company based in an undisclosed location, with a lean team of two. Their mission is clear: **optimizing eCommerce pricing through dynamic, personalized discounts.** 

**The Problem**

Ecommerce merchants often rely on guesswork when it comes to discounting strategies—whether it's for customer acquisition, holiday sales, or clearing inventory. This approach usually involves a subjective analysis of past sales data or simply what feels right. Naturally, this can lead to missed opportunities.

**The Solution**

Enter Promi. This AI-powered platform takes the guesswork out of discount allocation by leveraging data from the store. It dynamically determines the best discount values for each product based on user behavior, timing, and historical data. The platform aims to maximize both sales and profit by delivering tailored discounts to the right customers at the right moments.

**Key Features**

- **Personalized Product Discounts:** Create tailored clearance sales, volume discounts, and subscription offers.
- **Email & SMS Optimization:** Enhance campaigns by integrating personalized pricing that triggers via Klaviyo.
- **Onsite Popups:** Set up personalized interactions like welcome offers and sign-up discounts.

Promi's approach has notable results. In a recent case, a user reported a **92% increase in flow revenue** and significant improvements in open and click rates. This isn't just about offering more discounts; it's about using data intelligently to drive profitability, with reports showing an average revenue increase of **24%** and profit increase of **15%** across its users.

**How It Works**

1. **Data Collection:** Promi collects a variety of customer data—device types, sources of traffic, transaction history, and more.
2. **AI Training:** This data trains Promi's AI model to predict conversion rates and price elasticity for each customer.
3. **Dynamic Discounts:** It then issues personalized discounts based on the predicted behavior, which can apply in real-time or through email and SMS campaigns.

**Installation and Support**

Promi provides a **white-glove installation service**, ensuring that setup is swift, typically taking less than 48 hours. They focus on user-friendliness, enabling businesses of all sizes to enhance their discount strategies efficiently.

**Conclusion**

If you're in the eCommerce space and looking to refine your pricing strategy, Promi might just be the game-changing solution you need. With a focus on AI-optimized, personalized discounting, they're not just making discounts smarter; they're making businesses more lucrative.

For more information, visit [Promi's website](https://www.usepromi.com).
metadata.headline: Optimizing ecommerce pricing with dynamic, personalized discounts

4. **Integration with NetSuite**: Spherecast syncs seamlessly with leading ERP systems like NetSuite, enhancing its utility for businesses already using these platforms.

metadata.description:
## What is Yuma AI?

Yuma is automating customer support by providing an AI Support Agent orchestration platform. Yuma provides autonomous AI agents dedicated to customer service and e-commerce.

We integrate directly with help desk software (Zendesk, Kustomer, Gorgias, etc.) and focus on helping large Shopify merchants deal with their high volume of support requests.

Top merchants using Yuma can automate up to 60% of their support tickets fully autonomously.

## Why do Shopify merchants need Yuma?

There are thousands of large Shopify merchants around the world generating $10M+ a year. Most of them have taken over some niches and are great at what they do: selling their products.

But they all have one thing in common: they all hate customer support. It's a burden for them and a huge source of cost, as they receive hundreds of requests per day. Some of them have dozens of support agents on staff, usually offshore, and the overall quality is still often pretty poor while staff turnover remains high.

Those merchants have been promised automation for years but have always been disappointed by the outcome. As customers, we have all had to live through a terrible support automation experience before, so this is no secret, and everyone knows that the current state of the technology is quite bad.

## Yuma is solving this in a few ways:

Yuma isn't just another RAG chatbot. Our platform provides autonomous AI agents dedicated to support and ecommerce.

These agents are powered by knowledge, follow processes, and are managed by our in-house AI orchestration technology. This ensures safety, control, and quality at every step.

We believe that to truly automate customer support, we must develop a platform that mimics the actions of a human support agent. That's exactly what we've been doing.

Currently, our top merchants are automating 60% of their support tickets through Yuma. Yuma can fetch information from external services and take actions in other apps as needed to resolve each ticket.

We are laser-focused on building the best AI support agent platform and aim to achieve 80% true automation in the next few months.

## Fun Fact

Yuma got started by accident. This is my third YC startup after Socialcam (W12) and Triplebyte (S15). I released Yuma as a prototype for fun in mid-December 2022 and was overwhelmed with demo requests. That's when I knew I was onto something and had to turn this into a real company, once again.
metadata.founder_1_description: Currently Founder @ Yuma (W23) - Previously Co-Founder at Triplebyte (S15) & Socialcam (W12) - Seed Investor in 60+ companies.

At its core, Yuma AI is about automating customer support specifically for e-commerce platforms. Many Shopify merchants, particularly those generating over $10 million annually, excel at selling but dread customer support—a task that often leads to high costs and frustrating experiences. With countless support requests flooding in daily, many merchants are stuck with high agent turnover and unsatisfactory service quality. They’ve been promised automated solutions in the past, which often fell short of expectations, resulting in poor customer interactions.

### How Yuma AI is Different

metadata.generated_description:
**Company Overview: Rastro**

Founded in 2024 and operating out of San Francisco, Rastro is on a mission to revolutionize how we shop for home goods. It's an innovative AI-powered personal shopper focused on home decor, allowing customers to avoid the time-consuming task of rifling through countless online retailers. With a small but competent team of three, Rastro is already generating around $25,000 in monthly gross merchandise volume (GMV) with an impressive 15% profit margin.

The company was birthed from the minds of former Shopify AI engineers, who envisioned a platform that could aggregate products from across the internet based on individual tastes. Rastro aims for nothing less than to become the "Perplexity for shopping"—a reference to how they enhance the searching process through intelligent and personalized recommendations.

**How It Works**

Here's how Rastro operates in four streamlined steps:

1. **Connect with the Design Team:** Customers start by booking a quick 10-minute call with Rastro's design experts. This is where they discuss their vision and preferences while sharing images of their space.
   
2. **Product Sourcing:** Rastro’s AI agents then comb through over 40 different retailer sites to find unique home decor items that match the customer's style and budget.

3. **Product Selection:** Once the AI has curated a list of matching products, they’re sent directly to the customer's inbox for review. Customers can choose what appeals to them from this curated selection.

4. **Delivery:** Products are shipped directly to the customer's door without additional costs. Rastro earns money through referrals and partnerships, making it a free service for users.

**Market Potential**

Given that hiring an interior designer can cost thousands, Rastro presents a much more affordable option for consumers wanting stylish home decor. Their AI-driven approach has shown to convert at rates ten times higher than traditional e-commerce searches, making for a compelling case for both individual users and potential investors.

Currently part of Y Combinator's Batch S24, Rastro is tagged under consumer tech, retail-tech, and AI, indicating its growth potential in the expansive market of home goods.

The company is backed by significant expertise in AI and e-commerce, with figures like Tom Blomfield as a Group Partner. With its blend of innovative technology and user-centric design, Rastro is positioned to not just provide products, but to curate an experience. 

To learn more about their offerings or to start your personalized shopping journey, you can visit their [website](https://rastro.sh).

### Alpas: Revolutionizing Procurement with AI

Founded in 2020 and part of Y Combinator’s W21 batch, Alpas has carved out a niche in the procurement software space, particularly targeting mid and large-cap manufacturing companies. Headquartered in Berlin, Germany, this five-person startup is on a mission: to help procurement departments find suppliers **10x faster**.

#### What Sets Alpas Apart?

Alpas employs machine learning methods to deliver a comprehensive, 360° view of suppliers and supply chains. This means not only can procurement professionals assess potential suppliers more efficiently, but they can also benchmark suppliers globally, and analyze geopolitical as well as supplier-specific risks.

- **Chat-Based Interface**: Andi operates as a chatbot, allowing users to ask questions naturally and receive concise, accurate answers.

- 🔍 **Web Navigation**: With Andi, you can navigate the web more efficiently, sidestepping the usual distractions found in traditional search engines.

**The Verdict**  
Andi is a refreshing take on search, aiming to enhance the user experience with cutting-edge AI while prioritizing privacy and simplicity. If you're fed up with endless scrolling and irrelevant ads, Andi might just be the smarter, more efficient solution you've been looking for.

Mashgin creates better retail experiences through visual automation. 

We’ve built a self-checkout kiosk that uses computer vision to scan multiple items without barcodes, reducing checkout time by 10x. We’re completely recreating the checkout experience in an industry that’s had little innovation in decades.

metadata.generated_description:
### Mashgin: Reinventing the Checkout Experience

**Company Overview**
Founded in 2014 and part of Y Combinator's W15 batch, Mashgin is based in Palo Alto, California. The small but powerful team of 75 is on a mission to turn self-checkout into a seamless experience using cutting-edge computer vision technology.

**The Problem They Solve**
If you've ever stood in a long line at a grocery store, you know there hasn't been much innovation in checkout processes in decades. Mashgin is tackling this issue head-on. Their self-checkout kiosks are designed to scan multiple items at once—without the need for pesky barcodes—dramatically reducing checkout times by an impressive 10x. This means happy customers and minimized waiting, which is a win-win for both businesses and patrons.

**Results and Impact**
What’s more, businesses that deploy Mashgin's technology are seeing some serious results—up to a 400% increase in revenue and a 67% reduction in lines. The sheer efficiency and speed have made Mashgin's kiosks extremely popular, with over 40 million users visiting 4,000 locations monthly.

**Technology at Play**
Mashgin's kiosks utilize an advanced form of artificial intelligence characterized by deep learning techniques and sophisticated computer vision. The technology analyzes each item’s shape, color, size, and texture, making it incredibly efficient in identifying items and ringing them up automatically. With over 800 million transactions processed, their A.I. is constantly learning and improving.

**Industries Served**
Mashgin isn't just a one-trick pony. Their kiosks are making waves across various sectors, including:
- Convenience Stores
- Stadiums
- Cafes & Business Dining
- Higher Education
- Healthcare
- Ski Resorts

**Key Partnerships**
Mashgin has established connections with leading names such as Delek US and the University of Texas at Austin, solidifying their place in the self-checkout market.

**Conclusion**
In a world where retail is increasingly demanding faster and more efficient solutions, Mashgin is riding the wave of innovation with a clear vision: create better retail experiences through visual automation. If you want to know more, check out their [website](http://mashgin.com).

metadata.description: Smobi is an AI powered conversational marketing platform that helps e-commerce brands increase sales and improve their customer relationships via interactive SMS messages.
metadata.founder_1_description: Building Smobi - data for SMB acquisitions. Formerly an engineer at Amazon where I worked on large-scale notification delivery systems for Amazon Advertising.

Formerly Dover (YC S19)
metadata.generated_description:
Smobi is a fresh entrant in the e-commerce space, established in 2023 as part of the Y Combinator S23 cohort. Based in New York, this compact team of three is on a mission to transform customer interactions through SMS by integrating rich, in-app experiences. In essence, they aim to redefine how businesses communicate with customers, making it more engaging and effective.

At its core, Smobi leverages AI to deliver a robust conversational marketing platform tailored for e-commerce brands. The platform specializes in utilizing interactive SMS messages that not only enhance customer engagement but also significantly boost sales—reportedly increasing revenue by over 115% through dynamic campaigns. This isn't just about sending texts; it's about crafting rich customer experiences that feel personal and interactive.

Smobi's technology revolves around RCS (Rich Communication Services), which steps up traditional SMS by offering features like images, videos, and interactive buttons—all embedded within the familiar messaging app. Think of it as SMS 2.0, ideal for businesses wanting to stand out in a cluttered text message landscape.

Their platform is designed with ease of use in mind, seamlessly integrating with Shopify to help businesses create both manual and automated campaigns. Smobi provides a variety of templates aimed at simplifying campaign creation, allowing brands to launch campaigns quickly and measure the response through detailed analytics.

Backed by influential partners like Dalton Caldwell from Y Combinator, Smobi is gaining traction, with over 12,000 businesses already utilizing their platform to enhance communication and increase sales.

If you're a brand looking to innovate your customer engagement strategy, connecting your Shopify store with Smobi could be a game-changer. They offer customizable solutions, spam protection, and extensive analytics to refine marketing strategies continually. In a world where customer experience is king, Smobi is the partner that can help you amplify your messaging efforts effectively. 

For more details, you can explore their offerings at [Smobi's website](https://smobi.com).

metadata.description: Zentail makes adding online sales channels  for ecommerce brands as simple as adding a friend on Facebook.  Our mission is to make ecommerce simple and we do it with our ecommerce network that automates away all of the work getting a listing formatted for different marketplaces with different requirements.
metadata.founder_1_description: CEO & Cofounder of Zentail
metadata.generated_description:
Zentail is the company that streamlines the e-commerce landscape for brands looking to sell across multiple channels. Founded in 2011 and part of Y Combinator's S12 Batch, the company is based in Columbia, MD, and operates with a team of about 30 people. Its mission is straightforward: to make e-commerce easy by connecting brands with sales channels efficiently—like adding a friend on Facebook, but for online sales.

At its core, Zentail helps e-commerce brands automate the tedious work of listing products on various marketplaces, each with their unique requirements. Their platform provides a central catalog, simplifying processes like order management, product data organization, inventory forecasting, and analytics. Think of it as a comprehensive toolkit that reduces the time and effort traditionally needed to manage listings across platforms like Amazon, Walmart, and Target.

Zentail’s technology, especially its SMART Types feature, allows users to automate the listing process either by single SKU or in bulk, adjusting for marketplace requirements on the fly. This adaptability means brands can save time, maintain high listing publish rates (over 99%), and drastically reduce manual data entry—by about 90%, in fact.

Customers rave about the flexibility, ease of onboarding, and exceptional customer support. They can identify sales gaps across channels quickly, make data-driven decisions, and keep their operations running smoothly—all vital capabilities in today’s fast-paced e-commerce world.

If you're an e-commerce brand looking to optimize your multichannel strategy and simplify operations, visit [Zentail](https://zentail.com) to book a demo and learn more about how they can support your growth ambitions. They not only provide the tools to manage your e-commerce sales but also insightful analytics to help navigate the complexities of online retail effectively.
metadata.headline: We're making ecommerce simple connecting brands with sales channels
metadata.name: Zentail
